intro: Delissea spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed delissea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its reproductive structures include both stamens and pistils, typical of many monocot species. Delissea spathulata is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
